Description: More than 6,700 prisoners across Canada have tested positive for COVID 19 a rate much higher than the general population Yet a CBC News analysis has found that in some facilities, prisoners waited until May for their chance at a first vaccination
Title: Some prisoners not offered COVID 19 shots until months after general public, CBC analysis finds
Author: Val rie Ouellet,Sylv ne Gilchrist

Description: Negli ultimi decenni sono aumentate in frequenza e intensit le improvvise ondate di caldo marine che possono devastare gli ecosistemi Diventa allora sempre pi urgente definire modelli che permettano di prevedere questi eventi
Title: Gli oceani hanno la febbre, un altro effetto proccupante della crisi climatica
Author: redazioneRedazione Le Scienze Italia)

Description: One of the giants of the deep is shrinking before our eyes, a new study says
Title: Shrinking giants North Atlantic right whales getting tinier
Author: Associated Press

Description: One of the giants of the deep is shrinking before our eyes, a new study says The younger generation of critically endangered North Atlantic right whales are on average about three feet shorter than whales were 20 years ago, drone and aircraft data show in a
Title: Shrinking giants North Atlantic right whales getting tinier
Author: Associated Press

Description: New South Wales has recorded 19 cases overnight as Sydney endures its third day of a hard Covid 19 lockdown
Title: Covid 19 Australia NSW records 19 cases overnight as Sydney enters its third day of lockdown
Author: Charlie Co , Tita Smith
